page.title: 01A landscape of our area
page.content: The area covered by our survey includes three villages.They are Keele,Knutton and Silverdale.The latter was once the largest village in England. The area is geologically complicated. There is one major syncline and an anticline which have effected coal mining.The area is rich in coal,blackband iron ore,clays and sandstone.Standing on the Keele Hills to the South and looking North, the Apedale Fault is a major feature which changed the landscape and made coal mining possible. As the years have passed transport and roads have improved.Although the LMS railway once carried passengers into Silverdale and Keele,sadly the line is now only used by the Colliery. Housing has been modernised and extends in many directions.New factories have brought some industrial developments.
